Experience

Here's a quick look at my history in tech.

  • September 2017

    Engineering Resident - Google

    I'll be completing up to two engineering rotations on different teams at the Mountain View headquarters as I pursue a full-time software engineering position.

  • June 2017 - Septebmer 2017

    Software Engineering Intern - HealthTech Solutions

    As one of the first two interns for the startup, I helped create a multi-leveled admin portal with React + Redux to help manager users, messages, and permissions. I also handled all Android releases and implemented several app and API bug fixes.

  • May 2017

    Bachelor's Degree Graduate - University of Iowa

    After four fun years of undergrad, I graduated with a BSE in Electrical Engineering, BA in Computer Science, BA in Music, Mathematics Minor, and Honors. I also started UI's first hackers club and served as the analytics chair for Dance Marathon.

  • January 2017 - May 2017

    Teaching Assistant - UI College of Engineering

    I helped instruct over 100 students in the Computers in Engineering class, focusing on C++ programming, pointers, and data structures.

  • May 2016 - August 2016

    Software Developer Intern - Epic Systems

    I spent the summer in beautiful Madison, WI, working on a project to increase patient adherence to complex anticoagulant schedules using popular calendaring services.

  • February 2015 - May 2016

    Research Assistant - Iowa Institute for Biomedical Imaging

    I completed several individual projects relating to 3D medical image pre-processing and object segmentation, including an exact "peak" calculator and an efficient image denoiser.

  • May 2014 - November 2014

    JavaScript Engineering Intern - MetaCommunications

    During my freshman year summer, I developed a tokenizing UI that handled arrow key navigation, mouse clicks, and autocomplete-able entries.

  • It all
    started
    here.

    December 2013

    "Hello World" Programmer

    This was when I decided that I wanted to be in tech. Many thanks to CodeCademy and MIT Open Courseware for helping get me started.

PySNAC

Designed and developed a pair of portable devices that communicate audio in real-time via Wi-Fi. Communication is initiated via authentication and secured via strong end-to-end encryption.

Date: January 2017 - May 2017

Safespace

Innovated on a Chrome extension to remove specified content from the browsing experience. Won "2nd Place Overall" and the "HackHarassment" award at HackISU.

Date: February 2017

The Med Manager

Developed an Alexa skill to keep track of complex medication schedules. Won "Best Health Communications Hack" at ArchHacks.

Date: November 2016

3D Image De-noiser

Implemented a version of the TV-L1 primal-dual algorithm to de-noise 3D medical images up to 52% faster. Won "Best Undergraduate Poster in Bio-imaging" at the UI Research Open House.

Date: September 2015 - March 2016
